page.title: 15A VISIT TO THE R.O.F.
page.content: A group of eight children visited this factory on Friday June 14th and were given a talk and a guided tour of the area. The site covers 430 acres so there are less than 2 people per acre of land.The men get around the site on bicycles.There are 300 bicycles and one man is{employed}to repair them all. The mounds are built around the parts of factory which contain {explosives.The factory makes rocket {propellent.}Much of the produced material is{transported by means of a {narrow guage railway.Waste is often burnt and bangs can be heard when materials are tested.There are 500 buildings,all of them are spread out to reduce the chance of continuous reaction.{Nitric Acid and Hexamine} solution are used and large cooling towers are very much in evidence.
